item.title: Creating a Server Control Panel
item.dc:creator: @Coelho Coelho
item.description:
@Coelho wrote:

[quote=“veteran god: king cesar, post:44, topic:353208”]is it possible to give this to staff members to use?

it could be created like a new client all together, to connect to the server, and have the login screen. but rather than creating the in-game interface, it logs you into a staff control panel, options changing based on player rights…?

of course the client would be restricted to staff players, and you wouldn’t be able to log in without sufficient player rights…

???[/quote]
Almost anything is possible in Java, however the word “possible” dosen’t really mean anyone is going to make it.

Read full topic

item.title: Creating a Server Control Panel
item.dc:creator: @Syfal Syfal
item.description:
@Syfal wrote:

Wintercanon:

Nice tutorial, but servers shouldn’t have GUI as it dedicates memory to unnecessary components. It would be better to handle command input via the console/command line. But all in all, most people here would run their private servers on Aero-enabled Windows desktops so memory management is redundant for them.

I like GUI’s since it makes some server administration tasks much easier, and it’s much easier to look at. Plus, designing one can be a lot of fun

Read full topic

Now, Do I make a new ControlPanel.java or do i edit something?[/quote]

If you knew shit about java, you would know that you do make a ControlPanel.java, as the name of the class is ‘ControlPanel’, now how about you go back to VB.NET you whore.

item.title: Creating a Server Control Panel
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

[quote=“m1lkman, post:33, topic:353208”]To the noobs, I suggest picking up a Java book and reading it cover to cover, not just blow through but actually read and understand it. Java for dummies works. (I’m currently reading JavaScript for Dummies)

To the so called “Experts”, your job in this community is to help people out. You were a noob once and you had to ask a stupid question at one time or another. In order to better the community, you should take in the noobs instead of rejecting them. This will inspire them to make something from scratch instead of creating another useless Pi with 30 players.[/quote]

When you read

[quote=“jmk600, post:28, topic:353208”]Well, for those people who are being real dicks, WE ARE NEW CODERS, AND WE DO NOT KNOW WHAT TO DO, BECAUSE HE DOES NOT TELL US TO “MAKE A NEW DOCUMENT” OR “EDIT THIS BLAHBLAH” SO SHUT THE FUCK UP.

Now, Do I make a new ControlPanel.java or do i edit something?[/quote]
You don’t feel so inclined to help others.

Read full topic

item.title: Creating a Server Control Panel
item.dc:creator: @m1lkman m1lkman
item.description:
@m1lkman wrote:

To the noobs, I suggest picking up a Java book and reading it cover to cover, not just blow through but actually read and understand it. Java for dummies works. (I’m currently reading JavaScript for Dummies)

To the so called “Experts”, your job in this community is to help people out. You were a noob once and you had to ask a stupid question at one time or another. In order to better the community, you should take in the noobs instead of rejecting them. This will inspire them to make something from scratch instead of creating another useless Pi with 30 players.

item.title: Creating a Server Control Panel
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

falcon v5:

I Dont eaven understand it

falcon v5:

and im like pro at coding 317 server

problem.jpg

[quote=“jmk600, post:28, topic:353208”]Well, for those people who are being real dicks, WE ARE NEW CODERS, AND WE DO NOT KNOW WHAT TO DO, BECAUSE HE DOES NOT TELL US TO “MAKE A NEW DOCUMENT” OR “EDIT THIS BLAHBLAH” SO SHUT THE FUCK UP.

Now, Do I make a new ControlPanel.java or do i edit something?[/quote]
Any new coder’s first place to check out should be a proper tutorial/book, preferably the ones at Oracle. If you don’t want to do that then maybe you should “SHUT THE FUCK UP”.
Tutorials are not meant to be “open this, and copy this and DONE!!eleven!!”. This is not meant to be a spoonfeeding commmunity. You, as a new coder, are expected to attempt to learn yourself, and not just wait for the spoon to feed you.
/rant

Read full topic
